titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the C&U Poster Advertising Company Records, 1896-2004 and undated RL.11125
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-02-26 10:41:07 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: C&U Poster Advertising Company Records, 1896-2004 and undated
did.abstract: Outdoor advertising company founded in 1912 in the Champaign-Urbana, Illinois environs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded 1912 as the A.E. Price Company, but changed name to Champaign-Urbana Poster Co. Frederick H. Gillingham and Charles Loeb acquired the company in the 1920s, and Gillingham became sole owner around 1945. Company transfered to Gillingham's daughter Barbara, whose husband Bob Pope ran the company until 1980. In 1984 Bob and Barbara's son Kip Pope acquired majority ownership and ran the company until 2001, when it was acquired by Adams Outdoor.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original audiovisual and digital materials are closed until use copies can be produced.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The C&U Poster Advertising Company Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gift in 2004 and 2009.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], C&U Poster Advertising Company Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2004-0137, 2009-0108

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections: Outdoor Advertising Association of America Archives; Naegele Outdoor Records; Ohio Outdoor Advertising Corporation Records.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans 1896-2004 and includes photographs, slides, correspondence, ledgers and minute books, administrative and financial records, research reports and other printed materials. Legal materials include court proceedings, depositions, as well as published collections of local, state and federal legislation, zoning ordinances and court rulings. Organizations represented include the Hoopeston Advertising Company, Outdoor Advertising Association of America, Outdoor Advertising Association of Illinois. Included are the papers of Kip Pope, owner and manager of the company 1984-2001. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
